meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my two cents on Chants of Sennaar!

I've gotta say, I'm not exactly a linguistic anthropologist (although, Slant Magazine seems to think I am), but even I can appreciate the creativity and complexity that goes into this puzzle game. You see, Chants of Sennaar is all about deciphering ancient texts and uncovering hidden secrets - kind of like trying to solve a giant puzzle in your head (which, let's be real, is basically my entire life).

But seriously, the game does an excellent job of making you feel like a genius linguist, even if you're not exactly sure what you're doing (I mean, I'm no expert, but I'm pretty sure that's how most of us gamers feel half the time). It's all about using your wits and logical thinking to figure out cryptic messages, which can be super satisfying when you finally crack the code.

Now, I know some critics have called it "academic" (thanks for the vote of confidence, Slant Magazine), but honestly, that just means they're not getting enough out of it. Chants of Sennaar is like a big ol' treasure chest filled with puzzles and brain teasers - you can dig around in there all day without ever feeling bored or frustrated.

Of course, some critics have pointed out that the game can be a bit "academic" (okay, I get it), but I think that's just part of its charm. It's like trying to solve a giant crossword puzzle - you might not always get the answer right away, but when you do, it feels so darn good! And besides, what's wrong with being a little bit book-smart?

So there you have it, folks - Chants of Sennaar is an absolute blast, and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves puzzles, brain teasers, or just wants to feel like a genius for a few hours. Trust me, you won't regret it!
